sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"标志，象征，符号"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: symbol, badge, sign, signal, mark, token, attribute, emblem
means: symbol ： 指作象征或表达某种深邃意蕴的特殊事物。
badge ： 一般指金属证章或写有姓名的带状标志物。
sign ： 普通用词，指人们公认事物的记号，也可指某种情况的征兆。
signal ： 指为某一目的而有意发出的信号。
mark ： 普通用词，含义广泛。既可指方便于辨认而有意做的标记，又可指自然形成的标记或有别于他事物的特征。
token ： 语气庄重，指礼品、纪念物等作为表示友谊、爱情等的象征或标志。
attribute ： 指人或物及其地位、属性的象征。
emblem ： 指选定象征一个国家、民族或家庭等的图案或实物。

word_mean: 标〔记〕，标志，痕迹，斑〔点〕：表面、特别是皮肤或粘膜表面上可见之点、斑或其他有界限之区域
（1）在电报技术中，字符或代码的点或画的部分。与无信号区相对。（2）由比特表示的高状态（逻辑“1”）。与低状态（逻辑“0”）相对。

sentence.Network_en: Mark had for some time been making advances towards her.
sentence.Network_cn: 马克追她已经有一段时间了。

sentence.Network_en: Mark was condemned to do most of the work.
sentence.Network_cn: 马克被迫承担大部分工作。

sentence.Network_en: Mark was out of earshot, walking ahead of them.
sentence.Network_cn: 马克走在前面，听不见他们的声音。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 马克(MARK)汽车模型（东莞威镇五金厂）一个慢慢崛起的自主研发的品牌，目前产品主要畅销国外市场，主要以欧美，东南亚，日...[ …
# 标记(mark)的方法：把光标移动到需要标记的地方，输入m，然后输入标记名，例如a\r\n# 引用标记的方法：\'a ，即：单引号加标记 …
...t 是中的第20个。今日的T系由的象形字母变化而来。早先的字形恰似如今的字母X，叫做taw，意为“记号”（mark）。Taw是闪族语字母表和中的最后一个字母。语中的Taw的、。.（Tau）以及字母和的T都曾发作/t/.
记_百度百科 ... (8) 印章[ seal] (3) 标志,记号[ mark] (5) 胎记[ birthmark].

list.abs: 英语单词立体记忆 ... Water Margin 水浒 → marked 有记号的，显著的 → remark 评论，谈论；谈话.
there is no marked qualitative difference between the two ., 两者在质量上无显著差异.
足球英语_百度文库 ... shielding 用身体保护球 marking 盯人 save 扑救.
机械专业英语词汇（很全） - Lemon Tree ... lock seaming 固定接合 marking 刻印加工 parting 分段加工.

jx.jx_en_mean: To mark for sale at a lower price.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 减价：降低待卖商品的价格

jx.jx_en_mean: To deface by covering with marks.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 磨损，毁损：因痕迹斑斑而受损伤

jx.jx_en_mean: To mark for sale at a higher price.

phrase.cizu_name: be quick (或 slow) off the mark

jx.jx_en_mean: be fast (or slow) in responding to a situation or understanding something

phrase.cizu_name: leave (或 make) its (或 one's，或 a) mark

jx.jx_en_mean: have a lasting or significant effect

lj.lj_ly: he left his mark on English football.
lj.lj_ls: 他对英国足球运动影响深远。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)something which is particularly typical of or suitable for someone
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英)（某人）风格，特别适合（某人）之事

lj.lj_ly: ‘I took you out.’ ‘To a motel! That's just about your mark!’.
lj.lj_ls: ‘我带你出去。’‘去汽车旅馆！你就爱这样’。

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly Brit.)used to emphasize or draw attention to a statement

lj.lj_ly: I was persuaded, against my better judgement, mark you, to vote for him.
lj.lj_ls: 我被说服投了他的票，请注意，这不符合我的理智判断。

lj.lj_ly: to say he was their legal adviser would be nearer the mark.
lj.lj_ls: 说他是他们的法律顾问更贴切一些。

lj.lj_ly: his solutions are completely off the mark.
lj.lj_ls: 他的解决办法完全不正确。

lj.lj_ly: he had been a man of mark.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to instruct competitors in a race to prepare themselves in the correct starting position

lj.lj_ly: on your marks, get set, go!.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English mearc, gemerce (noun), mearcian (verb), of Germanic origin; from an Indo-European root shared by Latin margo 'margin'
Old English marc, from Old Norse mǫrk; probably related to mark

entry.def: A  mark is a small area of something such as dirt that has accidentally got onto a surface or piece of clothing.

example.ex: The dogs are always rubbing against the wall and making dirty marks...
example.tran: 那些狗老是往墙上蹭，留下了斑斑污迹。

example.ex: A properly fitting bra should never leave red marks.
example.tran: 合适的胸罩不会留下红色勒痕。

entry.def: If something marks a surface, or if the surface marks, the surface is damaged by marks or a mark.

example.ex: Leather overshoes were put on the horses' hooves to stop them marking the turf...
example.tran: 马蹄上套了皮套子，以免弄脏赛马场。

example.ex: I have to be more careful with the work tops, as wood marks easily.
example.tran: 我必须格外小心使用操作台，因为木头容易留下污迹。

entry.def: A mark is a written or printed symbol, for example a letter of the alphabet.

example.ex: He made marks with a pencil.
example.tran: 他用铅笔做了记号。

entry.tran: 标示;为…作记号;为…作标记
entry.def: If you mark something with a particular word or symbol, you write that word or symbol on it.

example.ex: The bank marks the check 'certified'...
example.tran: 银行在支票上标有“保付”的字样。

example.ex: Mark the frame with your postcode...
example.tran: 在这一格里写上你的邮政编码。

entry.def: A mark is a point that is given for a correct answer or for doing something well in an exam or competition. A mark can also be a written symbol such as a letter that indicates how good a student's or competitor's work or performance is.

example.ex: ...a simple scoring device of marks out of 10, where '1' equates to 'Very poor performance'...
example.tran: 简单的十分评分制，其中“1”即“极差”

example.ex: Candidates who answered 'b' could be awarded half marks for demonstrating some understanding of the process...
example.tran: 回答b的选手表明对这个过程有所了解，因此可以得到一半的分数。

entry.def: If someone gets good or high marks for doing something, they have done it well. If they get poor or low marks, they have done it badly.

example.ex: You have to give her top marks for moral guts...
example.tran: 你不得不对她维护正义的勇气竖起大拇指。

example.ex: His administration has earned low marks for its economic policies.
example.tran: 他的班子在经济政策上所获评价很低。

entry.def: When a teacher marks a student's work, the teacher decides how good it is and writes a number or letter on it to indicate this opinion.

example.ex: He was marking essays in his small study.
example.tran: 他正在他那间小书房里批阅文章。

entry.def: A particular mark is a particular number, point, or stage which has been reached or might be reached, especially a significant one.

example.ex: Unemployment is rapidly approaching the one million mark.
example.tran: 失业人数正迅速逼近百万大关。

entry.def: The mark of something is the characteristic feature that enables you to recognize it.

example.ex: The mark of a civilized society is that it looks after its weakest members.
example.tran: 文明社会的特征是照顾最弱势群体。

entry.tran: （品质、情感、情景的）标志，表现，迹象
entry.def: If you say that a type of behaviour or an event is a mark of a particular quality, feeling, or situation, you mean it shows that that quality, feeling, or situation exists.

example.ex: It was a mark of his unfamiliarity with Hollywood that he didn't understand that an agent was paid out of his client's share...
example.tran: 他居然不知道经纪人的报酬得从其客户的收入中出，这说明他对好莱坞太不了解了。

example.ex: Shopkeepers closed their shutters as a mark of respect.
example.tran: 店主们暂时停业以示敬意。

entry.def: If something marks a place or position, it shows where something else is or where it used to be.

example.ex: A huge crater marks the spot where the explosion happened.
example.tran: 巨大的弹坑标明了爆炸发生的地点。

example.ex: ...the river which marks the border with Thailand.
example.tran: 标明了与泰国分界线的河

entry.def: An event that marks a particular stage or point is a sign that something different is about to happen.

example.ex: The announcement marks the end of an extraordinary period in European history...
example.tran: 声明标志着欧洲历史上一个伟大时代的终结。

example.ex: That programme received critical acclaim and marked a turning point in Sonita's career.
example.tran: 那个项目赢得了评论界的好评，成为索尼塔事业的转折点。

entry.def: If you do something to mark an event or occasion, you do it to show that you are aware of the importance of the event or occasion.

example.ex: The four new stamps mark the 100th anniversary of the British Astronomical Association...
example.tran: 这四枚新邮票是为了纪念英国天文协会成立100周年而发行的。

example.ex: Hundreds of thousands of people took to the streets to mark the occasion.
example.tran: 数十万人走上街头庆祝这一时刻。

entry.tran: 是…的特色;是…的典型特征
entry.def: If a particular quality or feature marks something, it is a quality or feature which that thing typically has.

example.ex: Tragedy has marked Wilmette's life...
example.tran: 悲剧笼罩着薇尔梅特的一生。

example.ex: The style is marked by simplicity, clarity, and candor.
example.tran: 这种风格的特点是简洁、清楚、直截了当。

entry.tran: 将…归为;把…列为;给…确定性质
entry.def: Something that marks someone as a particular type of person indicates that they are that type of person.

example.ex: Her opposition to abortion and feminism mark her as a convinced traditionalist.
example.tran: 她对堕胎和女权主义的反对态度表明她是个不折不扣的传统主义者。

entry.def: In a team game, when a defender is marking an attacker, they are trying to stay close to the attacker and prevent them from getting the ball.

example.ex: ...Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand, who so effectively marked Michael Owen.
example.tran: 成功盯住了迈克尔·欧文的曼联后卫里奥·费迪南德

entry.tran: 马克(德国使用欧元之前的货币单位)
entry.def: The mark was the unit of money used in Germany before it was replaced by the euro.

example.ex: The government gave 30 million marks for new school books.
example.tran: 政府拨款3000万马克用于购置学校的新教材。

entry.tran: (煤气炉上表示温度的)刻度，挡
entry.def: Mark is used before a number to indicate a particular temperature level in a gas oven.

example.ex: Set the oven  at gas mark 4.
example.tran: 将煤气炉开至4挡。

entry.def: Mark is used before a number to indicate a particular version or model of a vehicle, machine, or device.

example.ex: ...his Mark II Ford Cortina.
example.tran: 他的福特葛天娜二代车

entry.tran: 留下深刻的印记;留下深远的影响
entry.def: If someone or something leaves their mark or leaves a mark, they have a lasting effect on another person or thing.

example.ex: Years of conditioning had left their mark on her, and she never felt inclined to talk to strange men.
example.tran: 多年的熏陶对她影响很深，她从不愿意跟陌生人说话。

entry.tran: 成就不凡;获得名望;成名
entry.def: If you make your mark or make a mark, you become noticed or famous by doing something impressive or unusual.

example.ex: She made her mark in the film industry in the 1960s.
example.tran: 她在20世纪60年代的电影界占有一席之地。

entry.tran: （理解力或反应）敏捷的/迟钝的，灵敏的/缓慢的
entry.def: If you are quick off the mark, you are quick to understand or respond to something. If you are slow off the mark, you are slow to understand or respond to something.
On your marks in British English, or on your mark in American English, is a command given to runners at the beginning of a race in order to get them into the correct position to start.

example.ex: On your marks—get set—go!
example.tran: 各就各位！预备！跑！

entry.tran: 不正确;不得要领;不够贴切/完全正确;切中要害;十分贴切
entry.def: If something is off the mark, it is inaccurate or incorrect. If it is on the mark, it is accurate or correct.

example.ex: Robinson didn't think the story was so far off the mark...
example.tran: 鲁宾逊认为这个报道根本算不上离谱。

example.ex: He's right on the mark about movies being out of step with American culture.
example.tran: 他认为电影正在偏离美国文化的看法完全正确。

entry.def: If something is up to the mark, it is good enough.

example.ex: The workers get rid of those whose work is not up to the mark.
example.tran: 工人们赶走了工作不符合要求的人。

entry.def: If something such as a claim or estimate is wide of the mark, it is incorrect or inaccurate.

example.ex: That comparison isn't as wide of the mark as it seems.
example.tran: 那种比较并非像看起来那么离谱。

entry.def: You can say mark you to emphasize and draw attention to something you have just said.

example.ex: We're not extremists, mark you.
example.tran: 你听好了，我们不是极端分子。

means.word_mean: 1. a number or letter indicating quality (especially of a student's performance);

sentences.sentence: "what was your score on your homework?"

means.word_mean: 2. a distinguishing symbol;

sentences.sentence: "the owner's mark was on all the sheep"

means.word_mean: 3. a reference point to shoot at;
4. a visible indication made on a surface;

sentences.sentence: "some previous reader had covered the pages with dozens of marks"

means.word_mean: 5. the impression created by doing something unusual or extraordinary that people notice and remember;

sentences.sentence: "it was in London that he made his mark"
"he left an indelible mark on the American theater"

means.word_mean: 6. a symbol of disgrace or infamy;

sentences.sentence: "And the Lord set a mark upon Cain"--Genesis

means.word_mean: 7. formerly the basic unit of money in Germany
8. a person who is gullible and easy to take advantage of
9. a written or printed symbol (as for punctuation);

sentences.sentence: "his answer was just a punctuation mark"

means.word_mean: 10. a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened);
11. an indication of damage
12. marking consisting of crossing lines
13. something that exactly succeeds in achieving its goal;

sentences.sentence: "the new advertising campaign was a bell ringer"
"the president's speech was a home run"

means.word_mean: 1. attach a tag or label to;
2. designate as if by a mark;
3. be a distinctive feature, attribute, or trait; sometimes in a very positive sense;

sentences.sentence: "His modesty distinguishes him form his peers"

means.word_mean: 4. mark by some ceremony or observation;

sentences.sentence: "We marked the anniversary of his death"

means.word_mean: 5. make or leave a mark on;

sentences.sentence: "mark the trail so that we can find our way back"

means.word_mean: 6. to accuse or condemn or openly or formally or brand as disgraceful;

sentences.sentence: "She was stigmatized by society because she had a child out of wedlock"

means.word_mean: 7. notice or perceive;

sentences.sentence: "She noted that someone was following her"

means.word_mean: 8. mark with a scar;

sentences.sentence: "The skin disease scarred his face permanently"

means.word_mean: 9. make small marks into the surface of;
10. establish as the highest level or best performance;
11. make underscoring marks
12. remove from a list;

sentences.sentence: "Cross the name of the dead person off the list"

means.word_mean: 13. put a check mark on or next to;

sentences.sentence: "Please check each name on the list"

means.word_mean: 14. assign a grade or rank to, according to one's evaluation;
15. insert punctuation marks into

auth_sentence.content: You can hear Mark Thompson's full speech here.
auth_sentence.res_content: You can hear Mark Thompson's full speech here.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You can hear Mark Thompson's full speech here.

auth_sentence.content: The assistant referee signals for offside against Mark Stewart.
auth_sentence.res_content: The assistant referee signals for offside against Mark Stewart.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The assistant referee signals for offside against Mark Stewart.

auth_sentence.content: Soon after, he teamed up with Mark Pritchard.
auth_sentence.res_content: Soon after, he teamed up with Mark Pritchard.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Soon after, he teamed up with Mark Pritchard.

Sentence.sentence: Perhaps it will become the mark of an author to reckon with that he or she is still published in hard copy.
An extraordinarily important study skill is knowing how to mark a book.
Students mark the main ideas and important details with a pen or pencil, yellow or blue or orange
By marking down the unit price.
Self-made billionaires in Beijing, tech innovators in Silicon Valley, pioneering justices in Ghana—in these and countless other areas, women are leaving their mark.
Mark is not fit to take charge of the Student Union.

means.word_mean: 痕迹, 污点, 斑

sentences.en: The spilt coffee has left a mark on the table cloth.
sentences.cn: 洒出来的咖啡在桌布上留下了印渍。

sentences.en: The monument bears the mark of age.
sentences.cn: 纪念碑上有年深日久的痕迹。

means.word_mean: 分数, 等级符号

sentences.en: He walked on air for getting a high mark.
sentences.cn: 他因得了高分而洋洋得意。

means.word_mean: 记号, 标记

sentences.en: Command of the mother tongue is the most distinguishing mark of the educated man or woman.
sentences.cn: 运用本国语言的能力是受过教育的人最明显的标志。

sentences.en: Every garment in the shop has a price mark sewn on it.
sentences.cn: 店里每一件衣服都缝有价签。

means.word_mean: 在…留下痕迹, 标出

sentences.cn: 这张桌子很容易留下印痕。

sentences.en: She was careful to mark her place before she shut the book.
sentences.cn: 合上书以前, 她小心地做了记号。

means.word_mean: 表示, 指明

sentences.cn: 他的沉默表明了他的愤怒。

means.word_mean: 给…打分

sentences.en: He marks the score in the basketball match.
sentences.cn: 他在篮球比赛中担任记分员。

means.word_mean: 作记号；作符号；留下痕迹
评分

jushi.english: According to the contract, the work is below the mark.
jushi.chinese: 根据合同,这项工程不符合规格。

jushi.english: He got full marks in the examination.
It seems to me that his shot is beyond the mark.
